item.title: Life Is Strange: Reunion Officially Reunites Chloe and Max in March
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix has officially announced a new Life Is Strange game, Life Is Strange: Reunion, and it will (as the name suggests) reunite Chloe and Max when it launches in just a couple of months.

Ahead of a livestream, Xbox officially unveiled the name, direction, and release date for Life Is Strange: Reunion in an Xbox Wire blog post. It's coming to PC and Xbox Series X|S (and, presumably, other platforms) on March 26th.

The goal, according to the Life Is Strange team, is to give Chloe and Max "the ending they deserve" and to provide a "thrilling finale" to the stories of both characters in a reunion "thought impossible". Be aware that spoilers for Life Is Strange and its sequels may follow.

If you're wondering how Chloe was able to return after the events of the original Life Is Strange, well, the team says it "may be due to Max's power", making reference to the conclusion of 2024's episodic Double Exposure, in which Max merged parallel timelines and recovered her Rewind ability.

Chloe, however, is "no prize to be won", as the Life Is Strange folks say; she's her own woman, which is why she'll be the co-protagonist of this game alongside Max.

They'll be trying to find their way back to each other over the course of Reunion, each offering "alternating views of the world" and "different-but-complementary perspectives" on the events of the story.

Once again, Max is able to rewind time, a power she'll be using to both escape and get herself into some pretty tricky situations. Chloe's Backtalk ability returns, too, allowing her to smart-talk her conversation partners.

We still don't know who's working on Life Is Strange: Reunion development-wise; will it be a triumphant return for original studio Don't Nod, or will Before the Storm and Double Exposure's Deck Nine be returning?

In any case, the game will be launching on March 26th. Stay tuned for more.
